reviews.body:
## Code Review

This pull request introduces a powerful and flexible year-based filtering system for the rankings page, complete with backend logic, frontend components, and sanitization utilities. The implementation is solid and includes good test coverage for the new logic. My review focuses on a few key areas for improvement: enhancing security by removing default credentials, improving maintainability by fetching dynamic data instead of hardcoding it, fixing a broken test case, and improving frontend performance with debouncing.

## Code Review

This pull request introduces an advanced year filtering feature for the rankings page, including backend logic for parsing year ranges and a new frontend input component. The backend implementation, including the sanitization utility and its tests, is well-done. However, there are several critical issues. The new `YearRangeInput` React component contains multiple hook rule violations and syntax errors that will cause it to fail. Additionally, a unit test for the `Rankings` page has not been updated to reflect the new input component, leaving the new functionality untested. There is also a critical security vulnerability in `docker-compose.yml` due to weak default credentials. Finally, a medium-severity issue is the hardcoded year range on the frontend, which should be made dynamic.
